intro: Oxypetalum pauciflorum, commonly known as the few-flowered oxypetalum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale pink flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture. Oxypetalum pauciflorum is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
